name: corruptively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that causes illegal, bad, or dishonest behaviour: They corruptively exploited the system. They grab the resources and sell them corruptively to international companies.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople are more sophisticated with financial bribery today and the relationships develop more cautiously, but not less corruptively.They plan to make it a crime to corruptively alter, destroy, or conceal a record, document or other object.The country's wealthy elite corruptively collude to gain an unfair commercial advantage.
